dread_assessments.threat_title: CLI Command Injection via Unvalidated Inputs
dread_assessments.justification: High damage potential from arbitrary code execution, moderate reproducibility via user input, moderate exploitability requiring user interaction, system-wide impact, and low discoverability due to input validation oversight.
recommendations: Implement strict input validation and sanitization for CLI parameters
Use least-privilege execution for build processes
Enable logging and monitoring for suspicious CLI activity

dread_assessments.justification: High damage potential from executing malicious build scripts, moderate reproducibility via social engineering, moderate exploitability requiring user trust, system-wide impact, and low discoverability due to spoofing detection challenges.
recommendations: Implement certificate pinning for CLI frontend authenticity
Use multi-factor authentication for build initiation
Enforce strict script signing and verification policies

dread_assessments.justification: Medium damage from information disclosure, high reproducibility via network interception, moderate exploitability for passive eavesdropping, system-wide impact, and medium discoverability due to common network monitoring tools.
recommendations: Implement TLS encryption for all data in transit
Use secure protocols with perfect forward secrecy
Regularly audit network traffic for sensitive data

dread_assessments.threat_title: Elevation of Privilege via Package Manager Vulnerabilities
dread_assessments.justification: High damage from privilege escalation, moderate reproducibility via package manager exploits, moderate exploitability requiring system access, system-wide impact, and low discoverability due to complex attack vectors.
recommendations: Regularly update and patch package manager integrations
Implement role-based access controls for package management
Enable runtime privilege separation for dependency resolution

dread_assessments.threat_title: Denial of Service via Resource Exhaustion
dread_assessments.justification: High damage from system unavailability, high reproducibility via resource exhaustion attacks, moderate exploitability requiring system access, system-wide impact, and medium discoverability due to resource monitoring tools.
recommendations: Implement resource quotas and rate limiting
Monitor system metrics for abnormal usage patterns
Design for graceful degradation under load

summary: All identified threats pose high risk due to potential system-wide impact and moderate to high exploitability. Prioritize input validation, encryption for data in transit, and privilege separation to mitigate these risks effectively.
